title: Cricket Cage And Base, late 19th century
medium: Rattan, bamboo, lacquered wood (base); fiber, paper, silk thread, feathers (imitation insects)
provenance: From the collection of Alexander Wilson Drake (source:  catalogue card).
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Upright rectangular cage (a) with two parallels and concealed door; attached by small brads to black lacquered wood base (b) with cabriole legs set at angles.  Inside cage, imitation black beetle and winged insect (dragon fly?) attached to bars.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cricket Cage And Base, late 19th century.
late 19th century. Rattan, bamboo, lacquered wood (base); fiber, paper, silk thread, feathers (imitation insects). Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1916-40-3-a,b.
